alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains; Far Northwest Highlands; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Northwest Highlands; San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; South Central Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 23 at 2:52AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...LIGHT SNOW TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING MAY CREATE SLICK TRAVEL CONDITIONS IN THE WESTERN/CENTRAL MOUNTAINS, ESPECIALLY ABOVE 8,500 FEET... A storm system will bring several waves of precipitation across New Mexico today through Wednesday morning. Snow levels should range from 7,000 to 7,500 feet today, then lower slightly by the overnight hours. Light accumulations of a dusting to around one inch can be expected below 7,500 feet, with one to four inches likely above 8,500 feet, especially along the Continental Divide and Sacramento Mountains. Locally higher amounts are expected on mountain peaks. Motorists should exercise caution and be prepared for rapidly changing visibilities and road conditions. Allow extra time to reach your destination. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit nmroads.com.
